intro: Talauma gitingensis, commonly known as the Gitingensis talauma, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and yellow. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its fruit is a small, fleshy berry. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
